#### Description
Transport Canada is soliciting proposals from qualified Supply Arrangement (SA) Holders to provide Acoustic Monitoring Data Management services.

#### Scope of Work
The successful bidder will be responsible for:

1. Characterizing and determining an accurate portrait of the usage of echolocation devices in vessels that are less than 150 gross tonnage (GT) and are frequently in the vicinity of the Southern Resident Killer Whale (SKRW) critical habitat.
2. Providing relevant and meaningful mitigation strategies to reduce the impacts of echolocation devices on SKRW.

#### Key Deliverables

* Determine the number of people/companies that own echolocation devices
* Identify the type and characteristics of devices currently being used, and those available for purchase
* Determine the purpose of echolocation devices for different vessel classes and the circumstances under which they are used
* Feasibility and implementation of the most relevant mitigation measures

#### Proposal Guidelines
Proposals must be submitted by the tender closing date and time to be considered. The proposed period of the contract will be from the date of contract award to August 30, 2023.
